Yeah I am ignoring it especially the ones in Southern France you definitely have got your years mixed up. Spain was still primarily Muslim but the golden age of Islamic Spain was over. Islam wasn't one monolithic entity. Most Muslims the crusaders fought were the Seljuks who were seen as heretics by most of the Arab Muslims. Not to mention the Egyptian Muslims actually sent envoys to the crusaders to work against the Emirs of Baghdad who had armies in and around the Holy Land.

The fact is Pope Urban was asked by Alexius I to send Knights over to Byzantium to help stop the Seljuk Turks from taking over. It was not a defence of western/Catholicism as many make it out to be - it was initially a defence of orthodox eastern Christianity which the Pope wanted to use to send knights to recover the Holy Land. Those are the facts.
Real Muslim aggression in Europe was by the Ottoman Empire in the 15th and 16th centuries.

WRITING.TITLE: When did today's sexual practices become societal norms?
WRITING.TEXT:
So most of us know (and stick to) the '4 bases' concept when it comes to sex (the escalation from foreplay to sex). The escalation is seen as normal today for everyone and if you have had sex it's likely you gone through all the 'bases'. So my question is: when did this became the norm?
In historical dramas set before the 1900's most couples just go straight to sex. In shows like peaky blinders and Boardwalk Empire (set in the 1920's) a lot of the other things are incorporated (I know these are not the best indicators). Foreplay and other things have existed forever but just wanted to know when it became the societal norm.

WRITING.TITLE: The standard on 'standard' is so bewildering
WRITING.TEXT:
So I've recently got into Standard on ranked and I am shocked at how bad some of my teammates have been. I am Challenger III rank but I feel I can go higher but I'm always let down by my team. Compared to Solo and Doubles at the same rank Standard players seem way worse - you can't even rely on them to make decent saves and they all just rush towards the ball at all times. This has happened multiple times - has anyone else had a similar experience ?
I feel because on Standard you can get ranked up by having a good team so many lesser players populate the higher ranks
